1.heading: Secret Agents.
1.title: Amazing Agent Luna
1.author: art by Shiei ; story by Nunzio DeFilippis & Christina Weir.
1.genre: Spy, science fiction and romance genres.
notes: "Reads from right to left, Japanese style."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Fifteen-year-old Luna was genetically engineered in a lab and trained to be the perfect secret agent. Now, Luna is sent to high school to spy on Count Von Brucken, her arch nemesis. But her training didn't include how to deal with the emotions she'll feel as she makes friends and rivals, and develops her first crush.

2.title: "The Balkan Reservoir Assignment"

2.series: K-7, Secret Agent) 8 p. in Miracle Comics, no. 4

3.heading: Secret Agents.
3.title: The Blank in the Comics strip collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726 f.B55

4.heading: Secret Agents.
4.title: "Blowing Up the Vyanka Bridge"
4.author: by F
4.appears_in: E. Lincoln ; art: Nick Cardy. 6 p. in Wings Comics, no. 27 (Nov. 1942).
notes: Jane switches from being a nurse to being a secret agent. Story takes place in Russia.
Data from Lou Mougin via The Grand Comics Database Project.

5.heading: Secret Agents.
5.title: "Composer and Secret Agent"
5.author: by Louis Wolfe
notes: A composer delivering his scores has to sneak information past the Nazis at the same time. I. Wolfe, Louis. k. Scores. k. Nazis. k. Secret Agents. k. Music. Call no.: PN6728.1.P3T7no.65

6.heading: Secret Agents.
6.title: "Condemned to Death!"
6.author: [No author]
6.series: Kent Blake) 7 p. in Kent Blake of the Secret Service, no. 5
notes: Summary: The Reds are sabotaging Marshall Plan aid in Greece. Kent Blake is met at the pier by an anti-capitalist mob, then goes undercover as a prisoner to learn communist secrets. The warden turns out to be a communist, and Blake is beaten but doesn't talk. He learns that tomorrow is the day the people of Greece are going to be inflamed for revolution, but Blake himself is sentenced to hang. At the last minute, a prisoner with a "vicious weasel-like face" turns out to be a British agent, and after leaving a pile of bodies in the jail the two agents get the "correct propaganda" flowing again to the people of Greece.

7.heading: Secret Agents.
7.title: Count Zartog, the Wicked
7.author: Pourbet.
notes: Cha Cha Comics, 200-?.
1 v. : col. ill. ; 30 cm.
"Graf Zartok, der Verdorbene, (c) 1994 Hofmann" is printed on the verso of the title page.

"The profession of secret agent knows its own share of troubles but fighting a powercrazed millionaire and his sexstarved, promiscuous wife, as well as coping with an equally sexhungry companion can prove to be too much for the best of men. As if this were not enough, an enormous servant and a ploy for world domination are also brought into play. Meanwhile, the protagonist is subconsciously tortured with sexual fantasies."
"Adults only."
Translation of Graf Zartog, der Verdorbene.

8.heading: Secret Agents.
8.title: The Damocles Contract
8.author: created, written, and drawn by John Byrne ; colored by Ronda Pattison ; lettered by Neil Uyetake.
notes: (Cold War ; v. 1)
"The Michael Swann dossier."
"Originally published as Cold War issues #1-4."

Summary (from SkyRiver): "The secret agent is called on to stop a defecting British scientist from granting the Soviets complete nuclear dominion over the free world, promising ample doses of intrigue and espionage."

9.heading: Secret Agents.
9.title: Eel Mansions
9.author: Derek Van Gieson.
notes: "Originally published as Eel Mansions 1-6 by Uncivilized Books."

Summary (from publisher via OCLC): "A supernatural soap opera noir. Situated in Mill City, a grimy place inhabited by new wave satanists, secret government agents, abducted family members, booze-hounds, record store clerks, conspiracy theorists, murders, and cartoonists. Van Gieson skillfully un-weaves a damning, knotted sweater of intrigue, suspense and dark humor."

10.heading: Secret Agents.
10.title: Hot Nights in Rangoon
10.author: by J
10.appears_in: H. Haupeur ; translated by Kali Mann.
notes: (Eros Graphic Albums ; 27)
"Adults only."
"Originally released by Eros Comix as a series of three comic books."
"Welcome to the orient! Follow the trail of tail as a secret agent with a taste for the eXXXotic travels to the Far East for a riot of danger, violence, and forbidden sex action!"
Translation of: Nuits Chaudes de Rangoon.

11.heading: Secret Agents.
11.title: Iga no Kagemaru
11.author: Yokoyama Mitsuteru.
notes: (Sunday Comics)
Complete in 15 vols.

Summary (from OCLC): Kagemaru is an Iga School ninja who works as a secret agent for the Tokugawa shogunate. Under the orders of Hattori Hanzo, Kagemaru fights the enemies of the ruler in various parts of Japan.

12.heading: Secret Agents.
12.title: "The Impersonation!"
12.author: art by Pablo Marcos ; story by Steve Skeates
notes: "His macabre mission brings a secret agent face to face with the supernatural!"

13.heading: Secret Agents.
13.title: "In the Balkans"
13.author: drawings by Massimo Iosa Ghini ; written by Maurizio Corrado
13.appears_in: p. 33-42 in Heavy Metal, v. 9, no. 4 (July 1985).
notes: Synopsis (from p. 4): "When last seen, Sillavengo had returned from his dangerous mission in the Sudan. He was in Palermo telling his friend Barto of his travels, and of the beautiful blonde Amelia Lindy and Silent Termozeta, a fascist he met years ago who had secretly met with Nadia Penjakoff (Sillavengo's ex-love and a secret agent)."
"End of the third episode."

notes: (Bochum : F. Kamp, 1972).

17.heading: Secret Agents.
17.title: "Judy Blonde, Secret-Agent!"
17.author: Bernard Baily, art
17.appears_in: 8 p. in Tales of the Unexpected, no. 100 (Apr./May 1967).
notes: Data from Michael Tiefenbacher.

18.heading: Secret Agents.
18.title: LXG : the League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
18.author: novelization by K
18.appears_in: J. Anderson ; based on the screenplay by James Dale Robinson ; adapted from the comic book by Alan Moore and Kevin O'Neill.
notes: "London, 1899. As the British Empire lies in mortal jeopardy, a top-secret initiative unites several of the most illustrious (and sometimes infamous) personages of the age: Allan Quartermain, famed explorer and adventurer; Captain Nemo, master of the undersea submersible Nautilus; Dr. Henry Jekyll, and his brutish alter ego, Mr. Hyde; Rodney Skinner, the Invisible Man; Dorian Gray, the ageless subject of a diabolical portrait; Mina Harker, surviving victime of the late Count Dracula; and a scrappy American secret agent named Tom Saywer. Together they form LXG. When a criminal mastermind known only as "The Fantom" plots to hurl the world into war, the League must race across the globe to foil the masked madman's insidious scheme. But they may not have reckoned with the traitor in their midst."

19.heading: Secret Agents.
19.title: "Make Jokes, but I'll Bet You 50 Bucks Diane Doesn't Have Fingerprints"
19.author: by Greg Evans.
notes: Summary: TJ tries to tell Brad she's a secret agent because she has a satellite dish in a neighborhood with cable.

20.heading: Secret Agents.
20.title: Missile Mouse : Rescue on Tankium3
20.author: by Jake Parker.
notes: "Featuring a guide to Missile Mouse's universe."
Summary (from OCLC): Missile Mouse, a secret agent for the Galactic Security Agency, must battle evil King Bognarsh who has enslaved an entire planet.

21.heading: Secret Agents.
21.title: Missile Mouse : the Star Crusher
21.author: by Jake Parker.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Missile Mouse, a secret agent for the Galactic Security Agency, battles deadly foes in order to rescue a scientist from the Rogue Imperium of Planets, which is trying to steal a doomsday machine capable of destroying the universe.

22.heading: Secret Agents.
22.title: My Grandparents are Secret Agents
22.author: created and written by Scott Christian Sava ; with art by Juan Saavedra Mourgues and Invasor Creative Art Studio.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): Did you ever wonder why grandparents travel so much? Why they always need the latest devices like hearing aids and pace makers? Why they always seem to "forget" the past? It's because they're really secret agents employed by social security. You may not know it, but your grandparents could be out saving the world from evil
and all before naptime!

23.heading: Secret Agents.
23.title: The Red Ruby
23.author: Lars Jakobsen ; translation by Lars Jakobsen and Robyn Chapman.
notes: (Mortensen's Escapades ; 3)
Translation of: Røde Rubin.

Summary (from OCLC): Mortimer Mortensen, a secret agent who travels through time to prevent thieves and saboteurs from rewriting history, journeys from 1802 Burma to the Titanic's maiden voyage to unravel the mystery of who stole the much coveted Red Ruby.

24.heading: Secret Agents.
24.title: The Secret Service : Kingsman
24.author: Mark Millar, writer ; Dave Gibbons, artist ; Matthew Vaughn, co-plotter ; Dave Gibbons (issue 1) and Andy Lanning (issues 2-6), inkers ; Angus McKie, colorist ; David Gibbons and Angus McKie, letterers.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
"MillarWorld."
"Contains material originally published in magazine form as The Secret Service #1-6."

Summary (from publisher via OCLC): "The world's greatest secret agent is on the most exciting case of his career. But will the end of the world as we know it take a back seat to training his street-punk nephew to be the next James Bond? Meanwhile, what's the secret link between a series of kidnapped sci-fi stars, the murder of an entire town, and a dark secret from inside Mount Everest? Under Uncle Jack's supervision, Gary's spy skills and confidence blossom, but when the duo learn what's behind the celebrity kidnappings, the knowledge comes at a price. The conspiracy begins to unravel, but who can be trusted when so many prominent figures seem to be involved?"

25.heading: Secret Agents.
25.title: SpyBoy : the M.A.N.G.A. Affair
25.author: script, Peter David ; pencils, Pop Mhan ; inks, Norman Lee ; letters & shading, Digital Chameleon.
notes: Complete in 3 nos. (13.1-13.3).

Summary (from SkyRiver): Yukio is a leading comedienne on television, but she is also SpyGirl, an expert secret agent for M.A.N.G.A. She has discovered, however, that there is something she can't remember. The answers to her questions aren't very comforting, but she does find out the truth about her first meeting with SpyBoy.

26.heading: Secret Agents.
26.title: Tinker, Tailor, Mutant, Spy
26.author: writer, Brian K
26.appears_in: Vaughan ; artists, Michael Ryan ; with Manuel Garcia & Raul Fernández.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
(Mystique ; v. 2)
Contains material originally published in magazine form as Mystique #7-13.

"Mystique is a shape-shifting mutant and former terrorist, recruited by Professor Xavier of the X-Men to be a secret agent. Her current mission: to find and destroy a deadly new strain of smallpox, one that's spread telepathically! Problem is, she's not the only mutant who wants to get her hands on this potentially apocalyptic bioweapon."

27.heading: Secret Agents.
27.title: Tom and Jerry Meet Mr. Fingers
27.author: by Carl Fallberg.
notes: (A Big Little Book ; 2006)
Summary (from OCLC): Tom and Jerry become secret agents to solve the mysterious crime of sabotaged military jets and bent railroad tracks.

28.heading: Secret Agents.
28.title: Wire Hangers : Under My Skin
28.author: created, written & illustrated by Alan Robert.
notes: ca. 150 p. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
Other title: Alan Robert's Wire Hangers.
"Originally published as Wire Hangers issues #1-4."

"When a wave of abductions plagues New York City, no one is safe. It's not a question of if, but of when you'll be taken. The Suicide King Killer is out there, preying on the weak. Will you live in fear, or stand up and fight? Pill-popping detectives, corrupt secret agents, and a mysterious, disfigured homeless man are all inter-connected in this horrific tale of revenge and redemption."

29.heading: Secret Agents.
29.title: Wonder Woman : Who is Wonder Woman?
29.author: Allan Heinberg, writer ; Terry Dodson, penciller ; Rachel Dodson, inker ; Alex Sinclair, colorist ; Rob Leigh, letterer ; Gary Frank & Jon Sibal with Dave McCaig, artists on "Backstory" ; introduction by Brian K
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form as Wonder Woman #1-4, Wonder Woman Annual #1."

Summary (from SkyRivr): Donna Troy takes over as Wonder Woman when Amazon warrior Diana goes missing, but when Diana returns, she resumes her alternate identity as secret agent Diana Prince while trying to decide if she will return to being Wonder Woman.

34.heading: Secret Alliance.
34.title: Tomo.
34.author: [No author]

contents.title: v.1. I was an eighth-grade ninja

notes: "Published in association with Funnypages Productions, LLC."

Summary (from OCLC): Hana would like to be like any other thirteen-year old girl. She's trying to fit into life at an American school, but she also battles hostile animal-like warriors from the dimension of Argon Falls. In discovering secrets about her identity and her past, Hana bravely faces her enemies and realizes her divinely given purpose.

Summary (from SkyRiver): When something goes horribly awry at a secret army base in the California desert, Charlie Campion and his family flee into the night, unaware that they carry a deadly virus that will spread a wave of death across the United States.

Summary (from SkyRiver): Former crime fighters Bob and Helen are now living "normal" lives with their children Violet, Dash, and Jack-Jack. But then Bob gets a chance to get back into action when a mysterious communication summons him to a remote island for a top secret assignment, and it takes the whole family to rescue the world from total destruction.

93.heading: Secret Code.
93.title: "Engineer's Secret Code"
93.author: Scott Adams.
notes: Summary: An engineer from the other company snorts and laughs in binary when asked about problems with the technology Dilbert's managers have agreed to buy.

94.title: Secret Coders
94.author: Gene Luen Yang & Mike Holmes.
notes: Cover subtitle: Get With the Program!

Summary (from publisher via OCLC): Welcome to Stately Academy, a school which is just crawling with mysteries to be solved! The founder of the school left many clues and puzzles to challenge his enterprising students. Using their wits and their growing prowess with coding, Hopper and her friend Eni are going to solve the mystery of Stately Academy no matter what it takes!"

105.heading: Secret Curses.
105.title: Batman : the Stone King
105.author: Alan Grant.
notes: (Justice League of America)

Summary: "Something has been unearthed in Gotham City, something that should not have been disturbed. An ancient pyramid has unleashed supernatural energies throughout the world. Drawn to the eye of this arcane storm, the heroes of the JLA become caught in the grip of a force far beyond their extraordinary powers. Only Batman manages to escape
but to free his allies and stop the chaos that is fast engulfing the world, the Dark Knight must somehow unlock the pyramid's secret curse."
Superhero fiction.

116.title: Le Secret de l'Espadon ; 3 SX1 Contre-Attaque
116.author: E

publication info.publisher: Les Editions Blake et Mortimer/Dargaud Benelux

notes: (Le Secret de l'Espadon ; t. 3)
(Les Aventures de Blake et Mortimer ; 3)

"Suite à l'attaque surprise des troupes de l'usurpateur Basam-Damdu, le capitaine Blake, de l'intelligence service et le professeur Mortimer son forcés de quitter precipitamment l'usine de Scaw-Fell à bord du Golden Rocket, afin de rejoindre leur base secrète et permettre à Mortimer de terminer la mise au point d'une nouvelle 'arme totale'" l'Espadon."

117.heading: Le Secret de l'Espadon. English.
117.title: The Incredible Chase
117.author: E
notes: (The Adventures of Blake & Mortimer ; 15)
(The Secret of the Swordfish ; pt. 1)
Translation of: Le Secret de l'Espadon, t. 1: La Poursuite Fantastique.

"In a past almost but not entirely like ours, the world lives in dread of a new power, an empire centered in Tibet and led by a megalomaniac. When the inevitable attack comes, it destroys all opposition, and capital cities across the planet are left burning. But, in Great Britain, Professor Mortimer, inventor of a mysterious weapon named the Swordfish, and his friend and protector Captain Blake have escaped the destruction, and must make their way to a secret base."

118.heading: Le Secret de l'Espadon. English.
118.title: Mortimer's Escape
118.author: E
118.appears_in: P. Jacobs ; colour work, Philippe Bierme, Luce Daniels.
notes: (The Secret of the Swordfish ; pt. 2)
(The Adventures of Blake & Mortimer ; 16)

"Fleeing the devastation of World War III, Blake, Mortimer and Nasir have been trying to reach a secret base with the blueprints for a new weapon, the Swordfish. But the forces of the Yellow Empire are hot on their trail, and soon Mortimer is captured. While Blake works tirelessly at coordinating the various resistance movements on the planet, the professor is forced to endure captivity, threats and torture from their eternal enemy, Olrik."
Translation of: Le Secret de l'Espadon, t. 2: L'Evasion de Mortimer.

199.title: Secret Agents
notes:
Secret agents are usually either spies or detectives, or both. See also:
  • Dinky Dinkerton, Secret Agent 6 7/8
  • Kent Blake of the Secret Service
  • Modesty Blaise
  • Secret Agent X-9
